docs.snippet: Why misinformation spreads so quickly in this conspiracy-theory election....
docs.lead_paragraph: Why misinformation spreads so quickly in this conspiracy-theory election.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof Zeynep Tufekci underscores how new technologies such as social media aid in dissemination and proliferation of conspiracy theories, like those surrounding Hillary Clinton's health; suggests more government transparency and change in economic models for sources of information could help curb spread of irrational misinformation.

headline.main: Did You Hear the Latest About Hillary?
headline.print_headline: You Hear the Latest on Hillary?

docs.snippet: Mrs. Clinton’s running mate, a senator and former governor, said he was not feeling added pressure to convince voters he is ready to be president....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mrs. Clinton’s running mate, a senator and former governor, said he was not feeling added pressure to convince voters he is ready to be president.
docs.abstract: Scrutiny over Hillary Clinton's health has propelled her vice-presidential running mate Sen Tim Kaine into more intense public spotlight; look back at his career shows that Kaine, who comes across as genial traveling salesman, has lengthy political resume but is not well known nationally.

headline.main: Scrutiny of Hillary Clinton’s Health Puts New Focus on Tim Kaine
headline.print_headline: With Scrutiny of Clinton’s Health, Running Mate Is Put Under New Spotlight

docs.snippet: When Hillary Clinton was diagnosed with pneumonia late last week, she informed a handful of her closest advisers, but pressed on with a busy campaign schedule and did not inform the public that she was sick. "I just didn't think it was going to be...
docs.lead_paragraph: When Hillary Clinton was diagnosed with pneumonia late last week, she informed a handful of her closest advisers, but pressed on with a busy campaign schedule and did not inform the public that she was sick. "I just didn't think it was going to be that big a deal," she said.

headline.main: Clinton Tries to Blunt Fallout From Not Disclosing Pneumonia
headline.print_headline: Clinton Tries to Blunt Fallout From Not Disclosing Pneumonia

docs.snippet: The U.S. economy could be $1 trillion (758.61 billion pounds) smaller than otherwise expected in 2021 if Republican candidate Donald Trump wins the presidential election in November, economics research firm Oxford Economics said on Tuesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. economy could be $1 trillion (758.61 billion pounds) smaller than otherwise expected in 2021 if Republican candidate Donald Trump wins the presidential election in November, economics research firm Oxford Economics said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Trump Presidency Could Cost U.S. Economy $1 Trillion - Oxford Economics
